title: Neeko passive inconsistency.
body:
In Neeko's passive it states _"Champion combat or casting damaging spells, breaks the disguise."_
If we want to be even more specific and to go to a 3rd party source _(ironically and sadly more informative than the actual client itself)_, when referring to Neeko it states being in combat as _"Damaging or taking damage from enemy champions"_

However, as a disguised Neeko, if you begin an auto attack windup with an enemy champion as the target, but _cancel_ the auto attack _BEFORE_ it fires, your disguise still breaks. Technically you're not "in combat" nor have you taken/received any damage. But the disguise still breaks anyway.

What's the reasoning for that?
It is contrary to both descriptions of her passive.

I have tested this while wearing moba boots, and I can confirm that when she winds up an auto against a champion, she breaks disguise but the moba boots do NOT lose their MS or go on cooldown. Despite them both being supposedly affected by the same "in combat" status.

{{sticker:sg-zephyr}} 

The way I see it, in the name of clarity and standardisation, something has to change:
Either the coding of Neeko's passive.
The wording of Neeko's passive
Or the coding of every other 'in combat' ability item in the game.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
